div.p: To manage memberships in the CRM app, start by creating the necessary membership levels under the Configuration tab.
Each level can be linked to a specific Pricelist if you want to offer special pricing to your members.

Next, create Membership Products by adding a service product in the Sales app and assigning the "Create Membership" action to it. Whether it's a regular product or a subscription, any partner who purchases this product will automatically become a member and receive the corresponding pricelist.

div.div:
Tips for success
Automate Your Renewals
Set up automatic reminders and renewal workflows in the Subscription app to avoid missed payments and lapses in membership. Combine it with automated email marketing to re-engage members who haven't renewed.
Use the Sign App for Smooth Onboarding Upload your membership agreements, waivers, or code of conduct to the Sign app. New members can sign digitally—no printing, scanning, or delays—making onboarding seamless and professional.
Segment Your Community for Better Engagement
Use tags and filters in the CRM and Email Marketing apps to segment your members based on interests, membership tier, or activity. This lets you send targeted campaigns and event invitations that feel personal.
Bundle Memberships with Exclusive Products or Events
Increase perceived value by combining memberships with exclusive items or access to special events using eCommerce and Events apps. Create attractive bundles to sell directly on your website.
Track Key Metrics in Real Time
Use dashboards and reports across CRM, Sales, and Subscription to track critical KPIs like membership growth, churn rate, and event ROI. Make informed decisions faster and optimize what works.
